name: Accelerated Shields
desc: Increases the turn rate of the ship's shields by %s and the rate at which the shields are raised by %s.
short: Increases shield turn rate and extension speed.

name: Adaptive Phase Coils
desc:
Phase coils are less able to maintain a connection with normal space as the ship's hard flux levels rise, resulting in a greatly reduced top speed as the coils struggle to gain traction.

This modification allows the coils to handle higher levels of hard flux, increasing the threshold at which speed bottoms out by %s. For standard-design coils with no other modifications, this takes the threshold from %s to %s.
short: Reduces impact of hard flux level on top speed while phased.

name: Advanced Optics
desc: Extends the range of beam weapons by %s, but reduces their turn rate by %s. Cumulative with Integrated Targeting Unit.
short: Increases beam weapon range.

name: Advanced Turret Gyros
desc: Increases the turn rate of all turrets by %s.
short: Increases turret turn rate.

name: Armored Weapon Mounts
desc: Increases the durability of all weapons by %s and reduces recoil by %s, but decreases weapon turn rate by %s. Also increases the ship's armor by %s.
short: Makes weapons harder to disable, reduces recoil.

name: Assault Package
desc:
Increases the ship's hull integrity by %s, armor by %s, and flux capacity by %s.

Will try to engage enemies and otherwise act as a combat ship in battle.
short: Increases hull integrity, armor, and flux capacity.

name: Automated Repair Unit
desc: Reduces the time required to repair disabled weapons and engines (in combat) by %s.
short: Increases weapon repair rate in combat.

name: Auxiliary Thrusters
desc: Increases the ship's maneuverability by %s.
short: Increases maneuverability.

name: Ballistic Rangefinder
desc: <tooltip created in the script due to lots of highlighting>
short: Increases base range of small and medium weapons in ballisic slots.

name: Blast Doors
desc:
Installs additional hermetic and heavily reinforced doors at critical junctures throughout the ship. Increases hull integrity by %s.

Ship takes %s fewer crew casualties from hull damage sustained in combat.
short: Increases hull integrity, reduces crew casualties.

name: Converted Hangar
desc:
Converts the ship's standard shuttle hangar to house a fighter bay. The improvised manufactory that produces fighter chassis is unreliable, and most components have minor defects. Fighter speed reduced by %s, and damage taken increased by %s.

Increases the minimum crew required by %s to account for pilots and bay crews. Increases the ordnance point cost of bombers by %s, and of all other fighters by %s.

Can not be installed on frigates, phase ships, or ships that already have proper fighter bays.
short: Improvised fighter bay for non-carriers.

name: Converted Fighter Bay
desc: Converts the ship's fighter bays housing built-in wings into improvised cargo holds, giving it an additional %s cargo capacity and reducing its crew requirements by %s per fighter bay. The crew reduction is limited to a maximum of %s.
short: Converts built-in fighter bays into improvised cargo holds.

name: Dedicated Targeting Core
desc:
Increases the range of ballistic and energy weapons by %s/%s for cruisers/capital ships.

Can not be installed on a frigate or a destroyer, and can not work in conjunction with Integrated Targeting Unit.

Most combat ships install either an Integrated Targeting Unit or a Dedicated Targeting Core, with the exception of more specialized variants.
short: Increases weapon range, more so for larger ships.

name: ECCM Package
desc:
Reduces the chance for missiles launched by the ship to be affected by electronic counter-measures and flares by %s.

A CPU core adjunct in each missile increases missile top speed by %s and missile maneuverability by %s, as well as significantly improving the guidance algorithm.

Reduces the weapon range reduction due to superior enemy Electronic Warfare by %s.
short: Improves missile speed and guidance, reduces effect of enemy Electronic Warfare.

name: ECM Package
desc: When deployed in combat, grants %s/%s/%s/%s ECM rating, depending on this ship's hull size.
short: Increases ship's ECM rating.

name: Escort Package
desc:
Increases the ship's maneuverability by %s. Increases the range of all point-defense weapons by %s, and increases the damage dealt to fighters and missiles by %s.

Will try to engage enemies and otherwise act as a combat ship in battle.
short: Increases maneuverability, point-defense range, and damage dealt to fighters and missiles.

name: Expanded Deck Crew
desc:
Reduces the rate at which the fighter replacement rate decreases due to fighter losses by %s, and increases the rate at which it recovers by %s.

Increases the crew required by %s per fighter bay.
short: Improves fighter replacement rate, increases crew requirements.

name: Expanded Magazines
desc: Increases the ammo capacity or the number of charges for ballistic and energy weapons by %s.
short: Increases ammo/charges for ballistic and energy weapons.

name: Expanded Missile Racks
desc: Increases the ammo capacity of missile weapons by %s.
short: Increases missile weapon ammo.

name: Extended Shields
desc: Increases the shield's coverage by %s degrees.
short: Increases maximum shield arc.

name: Flux Coil Adjunct
desc: Increases the ship's flux capacity by %s/%s/%s/%s, depending on hull size. Not as efficient as flux capacitors - most useful when added to a design that already carries the maximum possible number of capacitors.
short: Increases flux capacity.

name: Flux Distributor
desc: Increases the ship's flux dissipation by %s/%s/%s/%s, depending on hull size. Not as efficient as flux vents - most useful when added to a design that already carries the maximum possible number of vents.
short: Increases flux dissipation.

name: Shield Conversion - Front
desc:
Locks the ship's omni-directional shield emitter to a front-facing position and extends its arc by %s. In addition, the stable emitter position results in a %s reduction to the shield's upkeep cost.

As with all frontal emitters, the shield will also deploy twice as quickly.
short: Converts omni shield to front, extends arc.

name: Shield Shunt
desc: Removes the ship's shields. The external emitter nodes are replaced with reinforced plating, increasing the ship's armor by %s.
short: Removes shields, increases armor.

name: Makeshift Shield Generator
desc:
Installs a makeshift, inefficient shield generator on the ship. The shield emitter is locked in a forward-facing position and has a %s degree arc.

The shield generator draws much of its power from engines and reduces the ship's top speed by %s.
short: Installs basic shields on shieldless ship. Reduces top speed.

name: Hardened Shields
desc: Reduces the amount of damage taken by shields by %s. Also reduces the chance that shields will be pierced by EMP arcs from weapons like the Ion Beam.
short: Reduces damage taken by shields.

name: Hardened Subsystems
desc:
Increases peak operating time for ships that suffer degraded performance from extended deployment by %s.

Also reduces the rate at which combat readiness degrades by %s.
short: Increases peak time, CR degrades more slowly.

name: Heavy Armor
desc: Increases the ship's armor by %s/%s/%s/%s points, depending on hull size. Also reduces its maneuverability by %s.
short: Increases armor, reduces maneuverability.

name: High Scatter Amplifier
desc: <tooltip created in the script due to sections>
short: Reduces beam range; beams deal more damage and apply hard flux to shields.

name: Integrated Point Defense AI
desc:
Gives all small non-missile weapons the ability to automatically target incoming enemy missiles and to identify - and ignore - decoy flares. Targeting missiles takes priority over targeting enemy ships or fighters.

In addition, all point-defense weapons get the best possible target leading, regardless of combat readiness, and all damage to missiles is increased by %s.
short: Small non-missile weapons act as point-defense; PD not affected by decoy flares.

name: #Point Defense Integration
desc:
Reduces the ordnance point cost of small point-defense weapons by %s. The cost reduction only affects weapons that have PD capability as a feature of the weapon itself, and not when it's gained through other means such as from a hullmod.

In addition, all point-defense weapons deal %s more damage to all targets.
short: Reduces ordnance point cost of small PD weapons, increases all PD damage.

name: Integrated Targeting Unit
desc:
Extends the range of ballistic and energy weapons by %s/%s/%s/%s, depending on hull size. Can not work in conjunction with Dedicated Targeting Core.

Most combat ships install either an Integrated Targeting Unit or a Dedicated Targeting Core, with the exception of more specialized variants.
short: Increases weapon range, more so for larger ships.

name: Nav Relay
desc:
When deployed in combat, increases nav rating of your fleet by %s/%s/%s/%s, depending on this ship's hull size.

The total nav rating of your fleet increases the top speed of your deployed ships.
short: Increases top speed of deployed ships.

name: Neural Interface
desc:
Links the flagship with another ship, allowing switching between ships without using a shuttle pod. Both ships must have a Neural Interface and not be commanded by an officer or an AI core. The transfer is instant if the combined deployment points of the ships are %s or less.

If the linked ship is destroyed or leaves the battlefield, the flagship will establish a neural link with another ship with a Neural Interface. If the flagship is destroyed or leaves the battlefield, command will have to be physically transferred to another ship with a Neural Interface before a new link can be established.

Both linked ships benefit from your personal combat skills as if you'd transferred command to them, regardless of which one you're controlling personally. As with "transfer command", some skill effects - such as those increasing ammo capacity, or other fixed ship stats - do not apply.
short: Allows rapid switching between ships, resets system cooldown and adds a charge.

name: Neural Integrator
desc:
An augmented version of Neural Interface that works with automated ships by enabling direct control of all of the ship's systems via the link, instead of having the controlling conscousness aspect simply direct the bridge crew.

Links the flagship with another ship, allowing switching between ships without using a shuttle pod. Both ships must have a Neural Interface and not be commanded by an officer or an AI core. The transfer is instant if the combined deployment points of the ships are %s or less.

If the linked ship is destroyed or leaves the battlefield, the flagship will establish a neural link with another ship with a Neural Interface. If the flagship is destroyed or leaves the battlefield, command will have to be physically transferred to another ship with a Neural Interface before a new link can be established.

Both linked ships benefit from your personal combat skills as if you'd transferred command to them, regardless of which one you're controlling personally. As with "transfer command", some skill effects - such as those increasing ammo capacity, or other fixed ship stats - do not apply.
short: Specialized Neural Interface for automated ships.

name: Shield Conversion - Omni
desc: Converts frontal shields to omni-directional. Reduces the shield's arc by %s, and decreases its upkeep by %s.
short: Converts front shield to omni, reduces arc and upkeep.

name: Operations Center
desc: Increases the command point recovery rate by %s when installed on the flagship.
short: Increases command point recovery rate when on flagship.

name: Phase Anchor
desc:
Reduces the phase cloak's activation cost to %s. Increases the soft flux dissipation and weapon recharge rate by %s while phased.

When suffering critical damage that would otherwise destroy or disable the ship, able to initiate an emergency dive deep into p-space. The ship counts as retreated and will emerge into normal space when combat is over, suffering an additional penalty to combat readiness equal to %s its deployment cost. The ship must have enough combat readiness to cover this cost to initiate the dive.

Due to the immense distortions in p-space caused by such a maneuver, only one ship per battle - regardless of which side it's on - is able to perform it.
short: Increases flux dissipation and weapon recharge while phased, emergency dive maneuver.

name: Recovery Shuttles
desc: Reduces the casualties suffered by fighter pilots by %s.
short: Reduces fighter pilot casualties.

name: Reinforced Bulkheads
desc: Increases the ship's hull integrity by %s. If disabled, the ship will not break apart and is almost always recoverable after the battle.
short: Increases hull integrity; ship almost always recoverable if lost.

name: Resistant Flux Conduits
desc: Decreases the amount of damage taken from EMP weapons (such as Ion Cannons) by %s. Also increases the ship's flux dissipation rate while venting by %s.
short: Reduces EMP damage taken, improves venting speed.

name: Safety Overrides
desc:
Disabling safety protocols increases the ship's top speed in combat by %s/%s/%s (depending on ship size, with a corresponding increase in acceleration) and allows the zero-flux engine boost to take effect regardless of flux level. The flux dissipation rate, including that of additional vents, is increased by a factor of %s.

Reduces the peak performance time by a factor of %s, prevents the use of active venting, and drastically reduces weapon ranges past %s units.

Can not be installed on civilian or capital ships.
short: Drastic improvement in performance, much lower peak time.

name: Stabilized Shields
desc: Reduces the amount of soft flux raised shields generate per second by %s. Does not affect the hard flux generated as a result of shields taking damage.
short: Reduces flux upkeep for shields.

name: Unstable Injector
desc:
Increases the ship's top speed in combat by %s/%s/%s/%s su/second, depending on hull size.

Interferes with weapons targeting and other vulnerable systems, reducing weapon range by %s and increasing the fighter replacement time by %s.
short: Increases speed, reduces weapon range.

name: Additional Berthing
desc:
Increases maximum crew capacity by %s/%s/%s/%s, depending on hull size, or by %s, whichever is higher.

For civilian-grade hulls, also increases maintenance supply use by %s.
short: Increases crew capacity.

name: Augmented Drive Field
desc: Increases maximum burn level by %s.
short: Increases maximum burn level.

name: Auxiliary Fuel Tanks
desc:
Increases maximum fuel capacity by %s/%s/%s/%s, depending on hull size, or by %s, whichever is higher.

For civilian-grade hulls, also increases maintenance supply use by %s.
short: Increases fuel capacity.

name: Efficiency Overhaul
desc:
Reduces supply use for maintenance, fuel use, and minimum crew required by %s.

Increases the combat readiness recovery and repair rates by %s. The per-day supply consumption for CR recovery is increased to account for the increased recovery rate, but the total supply cost remains the same.
short: Reduces ongoing costs and enables more deployments.

name: Expanded Cargo Holds
desc:
Increases maximum cargo capacity by %s/%s/%s/%s, depending on hull size, or by %s, whichever is higher.

For civilian-grade hulls, also increases maintenance supply use by %s.
short: Increases cargo capacity.

name: High Resolution Sensors
desc: Increases sensor strength by %s points for frigates, destroyers, and cruisers, and by %s for capital ships.
short: Increases fleet's sensor range.

name: Insulated Engine Assembly
desc:
Increases the durability of the ship's engines by %s, and the ship's hull integrity by %s.

The ship's sensor profile is also reduced by %s.
short: Makes engines harder to disable, lowers sensor profile.

name: Militarized Subsystems
desc:
Removes the penalties from a civilian-grade hull, and increases maximum burn level by %s.

Increases flux dissipation by %s, and adds %s armor for the damage reduction calculation only.

Increases minimum crew required by %s.
short: Removes sensor penalties, increases maximum burn level, improves combat performance, increases crew required.

name: Solar Shielding
desc:
Originally developed by Diktat engineers after spending cycles dealing with the unique conditions of the inner Askonia system. Decreases the effect operating in a solar corona has on combat readiness by %s; also has the same effect against storms in deep hyperspace.

In combat, reduces energy damage taken by %s.
short: Reduces effect of being in corona and energy damage taken.

name: Surveying Equipment
desc: Reduces the heavy machinery and supplies required to perform surveys by %s/%s/%s/%s depending on hull size, down to a minimum of %s for each.
short: Reduces resource requirements for surveying.

name: Terminator Core
desc: Used by the terminator drone, this text should not be visible to the player.

name: Shared Flux Sink
desc: Handles %s of the flux dissipation of all attached modules. If modules are lost during battle, the extra flux dissipation is redistributed among the remaining modules. Up to %s of this extra dissipation applies to hard flux.
short: Flux/hard flux dissipation bonus as modules are lost.

name: Stealth Minefield
desc: Mines attack enemy ships during battle.
short: Mines attack enemy ships during battle.

name: Stealth Minefield
desc: Mines attack enemy ships during battle.
short: Mines attack enemy ships during battle.

name: Fighter Chassis Storage
desc: Fighter replacement rate does not go down when fighters are lost.
short: Fighter replacement rate does not go down.

name: Shield Always On
short: Forces shield to stay on. Hidden, doesn't need description or icon.

name: Missile Autoforge
desc: An autoforge inside the ship periodically fully reloads the magazines of all missile weapons.
short: Periodically reloads all missile weapons.

name: Shielded Cargo Holds
desc: Commonly found on ships that can't always rely on shields to protect their cargo from cosmic radiation. Only a few tweaks are needed to have the shielding confound long-range cargo scans, reducing the probability of contraband being detected.
short: Improves chance to avoid detection of contraband.

name: Salvage Gantry
desc: Increases the resources gained from salvaging abandoned stations, derelicts, floating hulks, and other such by %s/%s/%s/%s, depending on hull size. Only affects the recovery of common resources such as fuel and supplies, and not rare items like blueprints. In addition, %s of the bonus applies to post-battle salvage.
short: Increases resources gained from salvage.

name: Phase Field
desc: The ship is able to run a low-grade phase field for extended periods of time, reducing its effective sensor profile by %s.
short: Reduces fleetwide sensor profile.

name: Flux Shunt
desc: Allows the ship to dissipate hard flux at %s of the normal rate while shields are on.
short: Allows dissipation of hard flux while shields are up.

name: Civilian-grade Hull
desc: Increases sensor profile by %s. Reduces sensor strength by %s.
short: Increases sensor profile, reduces sensor strength.

name: High Maintenance
desc: Increases the monthly maintenance supply cost by %s.
short: Increases maintenance cost.

name: Monofilament Tow Cable
desc:
Improves the maximum burn level of the slowest ship in the fleet by 1. Multiple tugs can not be used to speed up the same ship by more than 1.

Can not be used in combat.
short: Increases burn level of another ship.

name: Drive Field Stabilizer
desc:
Stabilizes the fleet's drive bubble, increasing the maximum burn of the fleet by %s. The effect of multiple stabilizers is cumulative.

Increases the ship's sensor profile by %s.
short: Reduces fleetwide fuel use.

name: Ground Support Package
desc: Close support weapons and counter-measures for ground defenses. Increases the effective strength of planetary raids by %s, up to the total number of marines in the fleet.
short: Improves effectiveness of raids.

name: Advanced Ground Support
desc: Close support weapons and counter-measures for ground defenses. Increases the effective strength of planetary raids by %s, up to the total number of marines in the fleet.
short: Improves effectiveness of raids.

name: Delicate Machinery
desc:
The ship systems require excessive maintenance and do not stand up well under the rigours of prolonged engagements.

Increases the rate of in-combat CR decay after peak performance time runs out by %s.
short: Increases CR decay rate after peak time runs out.

name: Heavy Ballistics Integration
desc: Reduces the ordnance point cost of large ballistic weapons by %s.
short: Reduces ordnance point cost of large ballistic weapons.

name: Rugged Construction
desc: Reduces most negative effects of d-mods by %s. If disabled or destroyed in combat, the ship has a %s chance to avoid new d-mods, and is almost always recoverable after the battle.
short: Reduces impact of d-mods; ship almost always recoverable if lost.

name: Automated Ship
desc:
This ship is fully automated, and does not require - and can not take on - any human crew.

Automated ships require specialized equipment and expertise to maintain, resulting in a maximum combat readiness penalty of %s. This penalty can be offset by a fleet commander skilled in the use of automated ships.
short: Does not require and can not support crew.

name: Advanced Targeting Core
desc:
Extends the range of ballistic and energy weapons by %s. The range of point-defense weapons is only extended by %s.

Precludes the installation of a Dedicated Targeting Core or an Integrated Targeting Unit.
short: Greatly extends non-missile weapon range.

name: Targeting Supercomputer
desc:
Extends the range of ballistic and energy weapons by %s. The range of point-defense weapons is only extended by %s.

Also increases target-leading accuracy and greatly increases in-combat sensor range.
short: Greatly extends non-missile weapon range.

name: Experimental Phase Coils
desc: Reduces phase cloak cooldown by %s.
short: Greatly reduces phase cloak cooldown.

name: High Volition Attractor
desc: An experimental modification allowing high-frequency motes to be warped in by the rift core on board the ship.
short: Launches more powerful high-frequency motes.

name: Converted Cargo Bay
desc: This ship's cargo hold has been converted to house a pair of fighter bays. The improvised manufactory that produces fighter chassis is unreliable, and most components have minor defects. Fighter speed reduced by %s, and damage taken increased by %s.
short: Pair of improvised fighter bays.

name: Vast Bulk
desc: The main body of this structure is vast and is, for practical purposes, capable of absorbing any amount of damage from conventional weapons without being destroyed.

name: Axial Rotation
desc: This structure constantly rotates around its axis.

name: Anchor Rotation
desc: This structure rotates around its anchor attachment point. For station modules only.

name: Reduced Explosion
desc: Reduced explosion radius and damage.

name: Always Detaches
desc: Always detaches from parent structure when destroyed.

name: Never Detaches
desc: Never detaches from parent structure when destroyed.

name: No Weapon Flux
desc: Weapon fire costs no flux. Used on fighters for fine-grained control of effective shield hitpoints.

name: Do Not Fire Through
desc: Weapons on other modules of a station will avoid firing through this module, even though the shots would go over it and not hit.

name: Shard Spawner
desc: Spawns shard ships when ship is disabled/destroyed.

name: Do Not Back Off
desc: Sets DO_NOT_BACK_OFF AIFlag

name: Fourteenth Battlegroup
desc: This ship is a survivor of the original 14th Domain Battlegroup which founded the Hegemony. It is a prime specimen of the Domain Navy's "decisive battle" doctrine, particularly exhibited by a series of radical structural modifications (performed with pre-Collapse industrial methods) which allow the mounting of heavier armor plating by a flat increase of %s standard units, with only a %s reduction in speed and maneuverability. Exceptionally well-tuned energy systems increase flux throughput and capacity by %s over standard examples of this hull.

name: Militarized Hegemony Auxiliary
desc: This ship is - or was - on the Hegemony auxiliary list. Uparmour kits applied at Hegemony Naval yards resulting in no loss of performance for a %s/%s/%s/%s increase in armor strength, depending on hull size. Core power systems have been upgraded to military standards resulting in a %s improvement in overall handling, %s increase in flux capacity, a %s increase in flux dissipation, and an increase of maximum burn level by %s.

name: Compromised Armor
desc:
This ship's armor has taken major and irreparable damage at some point in the past, or suffered from major errors in the manufacturing process. Armor rating reduced by %s.

Supply cost to recover from deployment reduced by %s.

name: Compromised Hull
desc:
This ship's hull has taken major and irreparable damage at some point in the past, or suffered from major errors in the manufacturing process. Hull integrity reduced by %s.

Supply cost to recover from deployment reduced by %s.

name: Degraded Engines
desc:
Whether due to battle damage, manufacturing defects, or cycles of poor maintenance, this ship's engines are suffering from permanently degraded combat performance. 

Top speed and maneuverability in combat reduced by %s.

Supply cost to recover from deployment reduced by %s.

name: Degraded Drive Field
desc:
Whether due to battle damage, manufacturing defects, or cycles of poor maintenance, this ship's drive field is suffering from permanently degraded performance. 

Maximum burn level decreased by %s. Sensor profile increased by %s.

Supply cost to recover from deployment reduced by %s.

name: Faulty Power Grid
desc:
Whether due to battle damage, manufacturing defects, or cycles of poor maintenance, this ship's power grid will never be capable of achieving peak performance.

Flux capacity reduced by %s. Flux dissipation rate reduced by %s. Sensor profile increased by %s.

Supply cost to recover from deployment reduced by %s.

name: Phase Coil Instability
desc:
The phase coils on this ship are impossible to calibrate properly due to subtle flaws. Reduces the phase-time bonus by %s, reduces the peak performance time by %s, and increases the rate at which combat readiness degrades by %s.

Supply cost to recover from deployment reduced by %s.

name: Structural Damage
desc:
This ship's hull has likely taken extreme damage in the past, possibly to the point of breaking apart. Armor rating reduced by %s, hull integrity reduced by %s.

Supply cost to recover from deployment reduced by %s.

name: Glitched Sensor Array
desc:
The ship's sensor array is damaged past any repair short of a complete hull overhaul. Weapon range in combat reduced by %s. Sensor strength reduced by %s.

Supply cost to recover from deployment reduced by %s.

name: Malfunctioning Comms
desc:
The comm system has suffered serious damage, making punching through battlefield jamming even more of a challenge. Fighter engagement range reduced by %s.

Supply cost to recover from deployment reduced by %s.

name: Defective Manufactory
desc:
The manufactory that produces fighter chassis is unreliable, and most components have minor defects. Fighter speed reduced by %s, and damage taken increased by %s.

Supply cost to recover from deployment reduced by %s.

name: Damaged Flight Deck
desc:
The flight decks on this ship have taken major damage and seriously interfere with normal operation. Time to launch replacement fighters is increased by %s.

Supply cost to recover from deployment reduced by %s.

name: Unreliable Subsystems
desc:
A widespread loss of redundant components reduces peak operating time by %s, and increases the rate at which combat readiness degrades by %s.

Supply cost to recover from deployment reduced by %s.

name: Compromised Storage
desc:
The storage capacity of this ship is significantly degraded. Crew, cargo, and fuel capacity reduced by %s.

Supply cost to recover from deployment reduced by %s.

name: Increased Maintenance
desc:
Increases the monthly maintenance supply cost by %s. Increases minimum crew required by %s. Decreases maximum combat readiness by %s.

Supply cost to recover from deployment reduced by %s.
short: Increases maintenance cost and crew requirements, decreases maximum combat readiness.

name: Erratic Fuel Injector
desc:
Increases fuel use by %s and decreases the zero-flux boost by %s su/second.

Supply cost to recover from deployment reduced by %s.
short: Increases fuel use and decreases the zero-flux boost.

name: Faulty Automated Systems
desc:
Increases minimum crew required by %s and decreases maximum combat readiness by %s.

Supply cost to recover from deployment reduced by %s.
short: Increases minimum crew required, decreases maximum combat readiness.

name: Damaged Weapon Mounts
desc:
Reduces weapon turn rate by %s and increases recoil by %s.

Supply cost to recover from deployment reduced by %s.
short: Reduces weapon turn rate and increases recoil.

name: Degraded Life Support
desc:
Decreases maximum crew capacity by %s, and maximum combat readiness by %s.

Supply cost to recover from deployment reduced by %s.
short: Decreases maximum crew capacity and combat readiness.

name: Degraded Shields
desc:
Increases the amount of damage taken by shields by %s.

Supply cost to recover from deployment reduced by %s.
short: Increases damage taken by shields.

name: Destroyed Weapon Mounts
desc: Some of the original weapon mounts on this ship have been damaged beyond repair and can no longer be used.

name: Ill-Advised Modifications
desc: This hull's systems have been drastically modified from spec, likely without certified engineering oversight. Its systems appear to work correctly under routine conditions, but have a significant chance of critical malfunction when stressed.
